did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: Nine books varying in size and length
did.abstract: The collection consists of nine account ledgers: eight for Long's Store in Mt. Clinton, 1900-1921 (with gaps), and one for Long's Store in Green Mount (Greenmount), Va., 1869-1871.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The inside cover of one account book has the signature of William E. Long.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: William E. Long was postmaster at Chrisman, Va. (1881-1887), Green Mount, Va. (1889-1893), and Mt. Clinton, Va. (1893-1897). William's father, Samuel, established and operated general stores and post offices in all three locations. Of the three, William Long is known to have taken ownership of the Mt. Clinton store in 1897.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of nine books: one road book ostensibly from Long's Store in Green Mount, Va. (Rockingham County); three account books and five daybooks from Long's Store in Mt. Clinton, Va. Daybooks record purchases of general household goods and merchandise, such as eggs, butter, pens, pencils, shoes, yarn, chickens, roosters, sugar, dye, matches, hats and shovels. Account books typically record customer accounts, transactions and balances over time and do not record itemized purchases.

arrangement.p: Due to variations in size, the books are physically housed as follows in the Contents List.

scopecontent.p: This 16" x 7" x 1 3/4" daybook records daily transactions presumably from Long's Store in Green Mount, Va. Each page lists the date at the top of the page, then lists customer names, itemized transactions, and payments. Barter transactions are also recorded as credits. See Image

Labeled road book on the front and back covers, this 12 1/4" x 5 3/4" x 3/4" account book was most likely used for deliveries, presumably from Long's Store. It contains customer addresses in the front and itemized customer accounts throughout. A customer's name is listed at the top of a page that records dates and purchases. See Image

The number eleven is written on the front cover of this 12 3/4" x 8" x 1 1/2" book, indicating that several day books for this store existed. William E. Long Mt. Clinton VA May 14th 1901 is hand written on the inside front cover. The date is written on the top line in red ink. Below are customer names with a circled number next to the name. Itemized purchases and cost follow, with debit and credit entries. When an employee, family member, or other authorized person purchased goods on a customer's account, the name of the individual is listed near the debit or credit notation. See Images: 1, 2, 3.
The number fourteen is written on the front cover of this 15 1/6" x 7 1/2" x 2" daybook. The format of this book is consistent with the 1901 daybook described above. See Image

The number nineteen is written on the front cover of this 15 3/4" x 7 1/4" x 1 1/2" daybook. The format of this book is consistent with the two books described above. In addition, the inside front cover, final pages, and back cover contain printed information about rates of postage, money orders, foreign postage, and business law. See Image: 1, 2.
Number thirty-eight is written on the front cover of this 15" x 6 1/4" x 1 1/2" daybook. It contains the names of customers and their purchases with a circled number next to their name. See Image

This 14 1/8" x 9" x 2 1/4" book appears to be one of many account books that once existed for this store. It lists the customer's name at the top of a page and records dates and purchase amounts. See Image

Number forty-six is written on the front cover of this 15 3/4" x 7" x 1 3/4" daybook. It contains the names of customers and their purchases with a circled number next to the customers name. See Image

This account book was originally 13 3/4" x 9" x 2 1/4", but due to extreme deterioration of the boards and over half of the pages blank, only pages that contained text were retained. It contains an index. Unlike the other account books in this collection, transactions are recorded as page references with dollar amounts, but no dates. See Image
